Key:
So, what would you like to do today? You
have the floor, so I'm all ears, Maria.

...? What do you mean, Shido? Do we not have
school?

Huh? Oh, that's right.
So you see, Maria, today we're off from
school. It's a holiday, after all.

I see. I am aware there is no school on holidays,
but I had forgotten. I apologize.

No, you don't have to apologize. Did you
actually want to go to school?

Well, yes. There are many things that I have
yet to lose interest in.

If that's the case, then don't worry, Maria.
When the holiday ends, we'll go back to
school. Today's a break to do whatever you want.
Anything I want?

That's right. For example, you could spend all
day learning how to cook, or play games...
So Maria, got anything in mind?
Then, I wish to go on a date with you, Shido.

R-Right. We can do that too, but...
Is there anything else?

Anything else. Let me think. Then, I would like
to spend time with Tohka Yatogami and the others.
Young women of an age should bond together.

Yeah, that sounds good. I'd be happy to help
with you getting closer to Tohka and the others.
I see. Then let us proceed...

On second thought, if I do so, then I would no
longer be able to date Shido. So which should
I choose... Friendship or Shido?

When you put it like that, it feels like I'm
being put on a scale.

Isn't it simple? If you choose both, then
everyone wins.
Both?

Pick Shido and the others. If you go shopping
as a group, then you can bond with everyone.

A splendid idea. Truly wonderful. Would you
mind that, Shido?

If you're fine with it, Maria, then it's fine
with me.

Then it's decided. All right. I shall contact
everyone for you on your behalf.
Really? Thank you, Kotori Itsuka.

Leave it all to me. That's how things should
be. Shido, I'll leave the rest to you.
I don't mind, but aren't you coming, Kotori?

I'll sit out today. There's something I want to
investigate.

Well, if you say so, I won't stop you. We'll go
with Kotori tomorrow. Okay, Maria. Think about
shops to visit. I don't know what girls like.

Yes. We'll schedule a raincheck tomorrow.
I trust you, Shido.
Okay! That's that. We should get ready to leave.
Yes. Understood.
